drug.name: Carphenazine
drug.description: Carphenazine is an antipsychotic drug, used in hospitalized patients in the management of chronic schizophrenic psychoses.
drug.synthesis-reference: Tislow, R.F., Bruce, W.F. and Page, J.A.; US. Patent 3,023,146; February 27,1962; assigned to American Home Products Corporation. Sherlock, M.H. and Sperber, N.; US. Patent 2,985,654; May 23, 1961; assigned to Schering Corporation.
drug.indication: Used in the treatment of acute or chronic schizophrenic reactions in hospitalized patients.
drug.pharmacodynamics: Carphenazine is a phenothiazine antipsychotic agent with a piperazine side-chain.
drug.mechanism-of-action: A yellow, powdered, phenothiazine antipsychotic agent used in the treatment of acute or chronic schizophrenia. The term "phenothiazines" is used to describe the largest of the five main classes of neuroleptic antipsychotic drugs. These drugs have antipsychotic and, often, antiemetic properties, although they may also cause severe side effects such as akathisia, tardive dyskinesia and extrapyramidal symptoms. Carphenazine blocks postsynaptic mesolimbic dopaminergic D1 and D2 receptors in the brain; depresses the release of hypothalamic and hypophyseal hormones and is believed to depress the reticular activating system thus affecting basal metabolism, body temperature, wakefulness, vasomotor tone, and emesis.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenothiazines. These are polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a phenothiazine moiety, which is a linear tricyclic system that consists of a two benzene rings joined by a para-thiazine ring.

drug-interaction.name: Tetrabenazine
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Carphenazine is combined with Tetrabenazine.

drug-interaction.name: Deutetrabenazine
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Carphenazine is combined with Deutetrabenazine.

drug-interaction.name: Apomorphine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Apomorphine can be decreased when used in combination with Carphenazine.
